#summary Copy Directory (Recursive) from one location to another

= Introduction =

Add your content here.


= Details =

<pre>
-------------------------------------------------------------------
| Command Name :  | copydir                                                                            |
-------------------------------------------------------------------
| SYNOPSIS :             |  copydir [OPTION]... [DIRECTORY]..                                  |
| DESCRIPTION :       |  Copy directory from one location to another.                  |
-------------------------------------------------------------------

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
| Short Opt | Long Opt | Argument     | Desc                                                                   | Short Option Example   | Long Option Example       |
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
| -h        | --help   | not required | Show this help.                                                        | list -h                | list --help               |
| -f        | --from   | required     | Define source directory                                                | copydir -f C:\FOLDER1  | copydir -from C:\FOLDER1  |
| -t        | --to     | not required | Define destination directory.                                          | copydir -t C:\FOLDER1  | copydir -to C:\FOLDER2    |
|           |          |              | If not defined then the directory is written in the present directory. |                        |                           |
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

</pre>
